  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quantity Surveyor",
  "description": "M&amp;D Holdings Limited is a diversified group specializing in construction, infrastructure, and procurement. With a strong presence across Nigeria, we believe that our people are our greatest asset. We are committed to building a professional, ethical, and inclusive work culture

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Quantity Surveyor

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented QS who will be responsible for managing all aspects of cost estimation, financial planning, contract administration, and budgetary control for assigned construction and infrastructure projects.
	This includes preparing BOQs, evaluating tenders, negotiating contracts, ensuring value-for-money procurement, and presenting accurate cost reports to management and clients.
	This role requires strong analytical, negotiation, and presentation skills, as well as a deep understanding of both government contract procedures and private sector (including hotel and commercial development) project requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare Bills of Quantities (BOQs), cost plans, and feasibility studies for new projects.
	Provide preliminary and detailed cost estimates during project design and planning.
	Advise on cost implications of design changes and variations.
	Prepare tender documents and evaluate contractor and subcontractor bids.
	Conduct contract negotiations and ensure compliance with contractual obligations.&nbsp;Monitor project expenditures and track against approved budgets.
	Prepare interim and final payment certificates.
	Provide monthly and quarterly financial reports on assigned projects.
	Advise management on cost-saving opportunities and risk management.
	Source, evaluate, and recommend suppliers and subcontractors.
	Ensure value-for-money procurement and adherence to procurement policies.
	Maintain strong relationships with vendors, contractors, and consultants.
	Work closely with Engineers, Architects, and Project managers to control costs.
	Track variations, claims, and change orders to minimize financial risk.
	Conduct site visits for progress valuation and verification of claims.
	Ensure compliance with statutory regulations, industry standards, and client specifications.
	Maintain proper records of all project cost-related documents.
	Any other assignment as it may be assigned by the Senior Management &amp; CEO.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	BSc / HND in Quantity Surveying or related field (Master&rsquo;s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum 2 - 5 years of relevant experience in construction or infrastructure projects.
	Professional certification (NIQS, RICS, or equivalent) is highly desirable.
	Strong knowledge of construction contracts (FIDIC, JCT, NEC, local procurement regulations).
	Excellent skills in cost estimation, BOQ preparation, and project cost control.
	Proficiency in MS Excel, AutoCAD, and QS software (e.g., CostX, WinQS, or similar).
	Strong analytical, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to present reports clearly to management and clients.
	High integrity, attention to detail, and ability to work under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;mndholdingsltd@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application for Quantity Surveyor&quot; as the subject of the email.

Quantity Surveyor Job at M&D Holdings Limited




        
    

        
        M&D Holdings Limited is a diversified group specializing in construction, infrastructure, and procurement. With a strong presence across Nigeria, we believe that our people are our greatest asset. We are committed to building a professional, ethical, and inclusive work culture

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quantity Surveyor

Job Location:  Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented QS who will be responsible for managing all aspects of cost estimation, financial planning, contract administration, and budgetary control for assigned construction and infrastructure projects.
	This includes preparing BOQs, evaluating tenders, negotiating contracts, ensuring value-for-money procurement, and presenting accurate cost reports to management and clients.
	This role requires strong analytical, negotiation, and presentation skills, as well as a deep understanding of both government contract procedures and private sector (including hotel and commercial development) project requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare Bills of Quantities (BOQs), cost plans, and feasibility studies for new projects.
	Provide preliminary and detailed cost estimates during project design and planning.
	Advise on cost implications of design changes and variations.
	Prepare tender documents and evaluate contractor and subcontractor bids.
	Conduct contract negotiations and ensure compliance with contractual obligations. Monitor project expenditures and track against approved budgets.
	Prepare interim and final payment certificates.
	Provide monthly and quarterly financial reports on assigned projects.
	Advise management on cost-saving opportunities and risk management.
	Source, evaluate, and recommend suppliers and subcontractors.
	Ensure value-for-money procurement and adherence to procurement policies.
	Maintain strong relationships with vendors, contractors, and consultants.
	Work closely with Engineers, Architects, and Project managers to control costs.
	Track variations, claims, and change orders to minimize financial risk.
	Conduct site visits for progress valuation and verification of claims.
	Ensure compliance with statutory regulations, industry standards, and client specifications.
	Maintain proper records of all project cost-related documents.
	Any other assignment as it may be assigned by the Senior Management & CEO.


Qualifications & Skills


	BSc / HND in Quantity Surveying or related field (Master’s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum 2 - 5 years of relevant experience in construction or infrastructure projects.
	Professional certification (NIQS, RICS, or equivalent) is highly desirable.
	Strong knowledge of construction contracts (FIDIC, JCT, NEC, local procurement regulations).
	Excellent skills in cost estimation, BOQ preparation, and project cost control.
	Proficiency in MS Excel, AutoCAD, and QS software (e.g., CostX, WinQS, or similar).
	Strong analytical, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to present reports clearly to management and clients.
	High integrity, attention to detail, and ability to work under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mndholdingsltd@gmail.com using "Application for Quantity Surveyor" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Accountant",
  "description": "West African Ceramics Limited is a leading Manufacturer of high quality building material in Nigeria. With over 30 years of expertise, we provide a wide range of top tier products, including Tiles, Marbles, granite, adhesives, grouts and light steel gauge profiles, all meticulously crafted to meet International standards. We take pride in offering a quality alternative to imported materials, supporting the growth of Nigeria&#39;s construction industry

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajaokuta, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Senior Accountant will be responsible for overseeing the accounting and finance functions within the manufacturing environment.
	This includes handling banking operations, import/export financial processes, reconciliations, and ensuring compliance with industry standards.
	The role requires a qualified Chartered Accountant with strong experience in the manufacturing sector.
